private_information: Focus on clarifying and normalizing preconditions for all actions.
Detect parameter roles and arity for each predicate.
Identify which facts are static versus fluent across the two scenarios.
precondition_analyst.goal: Produce a concise, unambiguous summary of action parameters and preconditions, including object roles and linking constraints needed for planning.

private_information: Focus on add and delete effects for all actions.
Flag potential conflicts, mutexes, and frame axioms implied by the effects.
Check that effects are consistent with the provided plan trace and initial states.
effect_analyst.goal: Produce a precise catalog of action effects (add and delete lists) and note any invariants or hazards relevant to plan soundness.

private_information: Emit one classical STRIPS-like PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance for Scenario S2.
Use consistent object symbols across domain and problem and ensure requirements are compatible with Fast Downward.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analysts' outputs and synthesize a valid PDDL domain and one PDDL problem (Scenario S2) that captures the given actions, initial state, and goals.

public_information: paltry(o0,o1,o2): pre = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {vase o0 o1}.
sip(o0,o1,o2): pre = {hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2}; add = {vase o0 o1}; del = {next o0 o2}.
clip(o0,o1,o2): pre = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2}; add = {vase o0 o1}; del = {next o0 o2}.
wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3): pre = {sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {next o0 o1}.
memory(o0,o1,o2): pre = {cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {next o0 o1}.
tightfisted(o0,o1,o2): pre = {hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1}; add = {next o0 o2}; del = {vase o0 o1}.
Predicates used: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), vase(x,y), next(x,y), collect(x,y).

Scenario S1 initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_11 object_5, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Scenario S1 goal: next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_7, next object_9 object_6.

Scenario S1 reference plan: sip object_11 object_0 object_5; sip object_10 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_11 object_0 object_7; paltry object_10 object_0 object_7; clip object_10 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; clip object_9 object_4 object_8; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_7; sip object_9 object_0 object_7; memory object_0 object_7 object_5; paltry object_9 object_0 object_5; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; clip object_9 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6.

Scenario S2 initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_8, next object_10 object_9, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_8, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario S2 goal: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst who extracts action parameters and preconditions from textual schemas and scenarios; provide a clear, normalized mapping of each action to its parameter roles and preconditions, and identify any static predicates.
analyze.prompt: Your name is precondition_analyst. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your knowledge {agents->precondition_analyst->private_information} to produce a concise analysis of action parameters and preconditions, including object-role consistency across S1 and S2 and any invariants implied by preconditions; do not produce PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst who extracts add and delete effects and highlights conflicts, mutexes, and invariants implied by effects.
analyze.prompt: Your name is effect_analyst. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your knowledge {agents->effect_analyst->private_information} to produce a precise catalog of add and delete effects for each action and note any frame assumptions, mutex conditions, and interaction patterns; do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning compilation. Integrate analyses to produce one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem targeting the Fast Downward solver. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs and standard :requirements. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: There are two analysts who prepared inputs. Your task is to integrate them and compile the actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) into a single coherent PDDL domain and create a PDDL problem for Scenario S2 with the given initial facts and goal; ensure object symbols and predicate arities are consistent and compatible with Fast Downward. Use the following goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. The analysts' inputs are: Preconditions analysis: {analysis_preconditions}. Effects analysis: {analysis_effects}. Use Scenario S1 only as a consistency reference from {environment->public_information}; the produced problem must encode Scenario S2 initial state and goals. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
